column1: I’ve been having ongoing chest tightness and was told I should see a cardiologist. Who would be the right type of specialist?
I’ve been diagnosed with atrial fibrillation and want to speak to someone who regularly treats this, not a general cardiologist.
I get frequent palpitations and had a normal ECG before, but symptoms keep coming back. Looking for a cardiologist to review this properly.
I was told I might need a heart rhythm ablation. How do I find a cardiologist who actually performs these procedures?
I’ve fainted a few times and my GP mentioned it could be heart-related. I want a cardiologist experienced with blackout or syncope cases.
I have known coronary artery disease and want a private cardiologist to manage my long-term care.
I’ve been advised to get a CT coronary angiogram. Looking for a cardiologist who specialises in cardiac imaging.
I have SVT and want to explore catheter ablation with someone who does a lot of these procedures.
I was told I may need a pacemaker and want to speak to a cardiologist who specialises in cardiac devices.
I have heart failure and want a specialist who focuses on modern heart-failure management rather than general cardiology.
I’ve been having exercise-related chest pain and want a cardiologist who deals with angina and coronary interventions.
I have ventricular ectopics / PVCs and want to see a cardiologist who is comfortable managing complex rhythm issues.
I’ve already seen a cardiologist but want a second opinion from someone more specialised in electrophysiology.
I have a family history of sudden cardiac death and want a cardiologist experienced in inherited heart conditions.
I’ve been diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and want to speak to someone who specialises in cardiomyopathies.
I’ve had a heart attack in the past and want a cardiologist for structured follow-up and risk reduction.
I’ve been told I might need an ICD and want to discuss this with a cardiologist who regularly makes these decisions.
I’m experiencing intermittent chest discomfort and shortness of breath and want a thorough private cardiology assessment.
I want to explore catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation and would prefer someone who does this routinely rather than occasionally.
I’ve been told my symptoms are “probably benign” but they’re affecting my quality of life. I want a cardiologist who takes this seriously.
